intro: Aciphylla poppelwellii, commonly known as the Poppelwell's bracken, is a species of flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. This plant is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and its ability to thrive in rocky or sandy soils. Aciphylla poppelwellii typically grows in coastal and subalpine regions, where it is adapted to harsh environmental conditions. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually clustered in spike-like inflorescences.
